title: Marcelle Ninio, Israeli spy who spent 14 years in an Egyptian jail for her part in the operation that became known as ‘The Unfortunate Affair’ – obituary
text:
Marcelle Ninio, who has died aged 89, was an Israeli spy who spent 14 years in an Egyptian prison for her role in the infamous scandal which came to be known as “The Unfortunate Affair”; it led to a political storm – referred to as “the Lavon Affair” – regarding who had given the order to operate in Egypt, the key suspect being Pinchas Lavon, Israel’s defence minister.

In July 1954, Israel faced a pressing problem: Britain and Egypt initialled an agreement under which British troops would withdraw by June 1956 from bases in the Suez Canal zone, which Britain had maintained under a 1936 treaty with Egypt.

This caused much concern in Israel: if British troops were to leave, then British installations,...
